page.title: 14Children's Recreation N/Ham
page.content: Most of the children amuse themselves by playing imaginary games in the street, or at the local park,or on Wormwood Scrubs.There is an adventure playground on the Scrubs, made mainly from wood. The games are very similar all over the country. Some children play with bouncing balls, or footballs,pretending to be their favourite footballer.Others play with skipping ropes or hoops. In most areas clubs are set up for children to go to on certain evenings. These clubs usually provide table tennis,pool,snooker,rounders,cricket, football,board games and art and craft activities.Sometimes the children are taken to the cinema in Acton to see films. Children amuse themselves for most of the time by watching television or video films.Many spend up to five hours a day watching television.
